page.title: 05Housing
page.content: Grantown contains a wide range of house sizes and styles. Originally it was an{18th Century planned town.}The first houses were built around its {central Square. These were of stone with slate roofs in contrast to the turf huts common locally then. From then, Grantown has developed through large Victorian villas to modern bungalows and semi-detached houses, both local authority and private. These newer housing schemes tend to be mostly on the outskirts. The oldest housing is in the centre and, like Victorian villas, is of stone. Newer housing is of concrete on a timber frame. An interesting development of the 1980s is the modernisation of old 18th and 19th Century properties in the centre of the town.
